frame.name: Passing
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> physically transfers a <fen>Theme</fen> to a <fen>Recipient</fen>. The <fen>Agent</fen> is not under control of the <fen>Theme</fen>'s motion after the initial input of energy.
Compare with Bringing and Sending. In the former, the Carrier is in constant control (even physical contact) with the Theme. In the latter, the Sender plans the motion of the Theme and places it in circumstances such that it travels along the specified path (or to the specified goal), but under the power of a separate individual.</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the one who passes the <fen>Theme</fen>. The <fen>Agent</fen> is generally realized as the External Argument.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Pat</fex> <t>passed</t> me the ball.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Theme</fen> is generally an NP Object that is passed to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>Pat <t>passed</t> <fex name="Theme">the ball</fex> to the goalie.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Source</fen> is the starting point of the passing action
<ex>Pat <t>passed</t> the ball <fex name="Source">from behind the defensemen</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex>I <t>passed</t> him the ball <fex name="Path">over the wall</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Recipient</fen> is the entity which possesses the <fen>Theme</fen> as a result of the passing.
<ex>Kim <t>passed</t> the salt <fex name="Recipient">to her mother</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Distance</fen> is any expression characterizing the extent of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>Pat <t>passed</t> the ball <fex name="Distance">50 meters</fex> to me.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Area
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which passing takes place when the passing is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. Locative setting adjuncts may also be assigned this frame element.
<ex>The team <t>passed</t> the ball <fex name="Area">around the court</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of a participant during the passing action. <ex>We <t>passed</t> the ball around, <fex name="Depictive">gleeful</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Means</fen> indicates the action that is taken that results in the motion of the <fen>Theme</fen> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Manner</fen> is any expression which describes a property of the motion of the <fen>Theme</fen> which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions. </def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity saliently involved in the transmission of force from an <fen>Agent</fen> to a <fen>Theme</fen>. It may be the <fen>Agent</fen>'s bodypart, or some kind of device.
<ex>When playing basketball, you should <t>pass</t> <fex name="Ins">with both hands</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area that provides a setting for a specific motion (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>).
<ex>The players <t>passed</t> the ball to each other <fex name="Place">at the park</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the passing of the <fen>Theme</fen> occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition:
<def-root>A resultant state that the <fen>Theme</fen> is in at the end of its motion.
<ex>The center <t>passed</t> the ball <fex name="Result">clear of the double-team</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Initial_State
FE.definition:
<def-root>A previous state that the <fen>Theme</fen> was in before the beginning of its motion.
<ex>Paul <t>passed</t> the ball away <fex name="Initial_State">from the danger of the double-team</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes a proposition from which the main clause logically follows.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: pass.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: transfer, hand something to someone.
